Posts.Content: Merry christmas to all you angels in pink. I believe angels are soft but very strong. They are courageous because they protect us. I pray courage and strength and protection and health for our bodies, minds and souls. "Every time you hear a bell ring, an angel gets it's wings", from the movie It's a Wonderful Life. Posts.Title: Pink Gloves On - Back in the ring for Round 3!!

Posts.Content: I had a Lumpectomy and removal of lymph nodes followed by a pet scan prior to chemo. 3 months after radiation had a mammo with ultra sound. Last week I had a cat and bone scan. It will be one year on June 15 that all my treatment was completed. I still have my port, and hopefully will have it removed after all the scan results are in. As you can see, each oncologist does things just a bit differently. Mine was ER+ Her2- and Stage 2 very aggressive.
Posts.Title: Pet Scan info

Posts.Content: Chemo Chicks I have the dry crusty eyes, and just keep on rubbing them. This is one heck of an adventure for sure. They cut us, poke our veins, install ports, and serve us "cocktails" with all kinds of hangover effects. We then get shots to build us up, because our cocktails take us way down to the point of exhaustion. Did anyone say barbaric? I'm trying to be humorous, but who can deny this.
Posts.Title: Chemo Chicks

Posts.Content: LOVE hearing from you on these boards. I miss your sense of humor and sweet ways. I pray that rash is nothing, please keep us informed. Lots of hugs.
Posts.Title: Stopping by....

Posts.Title: Feeling Bad but Looking forward to Heart Cath Tomorrow

Posts.Content: Yes, particularly when you are actively going thru chemo treatment.
Posts.Title: Taxol or perhaps A/C changed my eyesight!

Posts.Content: 1. I had a lumpectomy, and then 2nd surgery to remove rest of lymph nodes. You look fairly young, but surgery knocks the you know what out of you. Get all the help you can. This cancer business is no cake walk. 2. Make plans to have other people do Thanksgiving this year, so you can sit back and mend. 3. Oh the loved ones!! They need to also go thru their fears, concerns, and emotions. Let them, but remember you cant fix them and they cannot fix you. Try to detach from their drama. You need your energy for you. In the kindest way possible, I gradually had to train some of my relatives on how I wanted to be treated. I had to let them know that I was a big girl, I had qualified doctors, and I was doing eveything I could to follow all the doctor's expert advice. 4. Be sure to come back here often. You will find a group of the most supportive, knowledgeable, amazing people who really know whats happening. You can usually find an answer to almost any question you may have. It's unfortunate, that like the rest of us, you have reason to be here. That being said, welcome to a very supportive network of new friends.
Posts.Title: Rookie could use some advice

Posts.Content: Cvolk another suggestion for relatives. A website called Caringbridge that can keep all those out of state relatives updated. I personally have not used it, but have heard really good things about it. I'm guessing it would cut down on phone calls.
Posts.Title: Rookie could use some advice

Posts.Content: oH jUDY so happy for your family. Enjoy that little guy.May he have many wonderful flourishing years.
Posts.Title: Sharing Good News - New Great Grandson (Non-breast cancer related)

Posts.Content: A middle man is an excellent way to deal with those exhausting loved ones. They mean well, but you dont need any additonal drain of your energy. My husband hates talking on the phone, and at times will not answer it. If I'm having a bad day sometimes I just let it ring and get back to them when I'm up to it. At other times, I'll pick up, let them know I'm having a bad day and ask that they call or visit when I'm feeling better. My relatives get all shook up if they cant reach me, and many are out of state, so one way or the other they want updates. Emails also work.

Posts.Content: Hi Pink sisters. My Turn Now I really like this idea. Natly is named after my dad who died of metatastic (spelling??) lung cancer in 1997. Some of his cousins called him Natly. His name was Natale Leonardi. Natale means Christmas in Italian. The 15 is my birthday. I would have used my real name had I realized many of the gals on the boards do just that, however being ever so sceptical of what one provides on the internet I chose Natly15 which I love. My real name is Sandra but my friends call me Sandy. I would not have minded being named Natalie, really like that name. :)

Posts.Content: Last year I worked on building energy and stamina. As I look back I'm a little stronger physically, not where I want to be but improving. Had a rough year with bronchitis. This year I PRAY and hope I'll lose some weight and improve my eating habits. Health is my motivation this year. Better eating and more energy. I will continue to laugh and try not being quite so judgemental.

Posts.Title: What's in your name?

Posts.Content: I had 8 rounds of chemo 3 weeks apart. Started Oct 6, 2009 and finished March 30, 2010. Had 4 rounds of adriamycin and cytoxan, and then 1 1/2 rounds of taxol and then 3 taxotere. My body reacted adversely to the taxol so they switched me to taxotere. This was done after 2 surgeries. My tumor was small but aggressive and had already invaded the sentinel lymph node. We are all so different and so unique as is each oncologist. So many factors figure in to our individual treatment. Based on age, stage and several other factors my onc deemed it necessary for me to do the 8 rounds. Wishing you the best as you become a chemo chick.

Posts.Content: I switched to emend and Kytril and that did the trick for me. Zofran and compazine didnt do it for me. I had the opposite, serious constipation. Hope you are doing better today. Chemo is tough hope they get it all figued out for you. Our bodies are all so different and so are our reactions and responses to treatments. I call cancer treatment a crap shoot, or like "a box of chocolates" you never know what you are going to get. a prayers being sent your way.

Posts.Title: Thursday the 25th is Green Eyed Girls Birthday

Posts.Content: As I was preparing for the arrival of my son and his family, I became quite exhausted, told my husband, and asked him to do 4 or 5 minor things. He doesnt mind doing things of his choosing as long as it's done in his time frame. When we got to making the bed, he called me a dictator, and I just broke out in tears. He was feeling pretty bad after my tearful reaction, so he switched gears, and said, " Well you are the only bald headed dictator I know". My tears immediately switched to an outburst of laughter. My emotions are so strange, and yes I do take zoloft. I was never one for crying, but now I can cry at a drop of a hat.
Posts.Title: Bald Headed Dictator

Folks, if this is true, then maybe Obama really has lost touch with the American people." –Conan O'Brien
Posts.Title: The Best of Late Night...

Posts.Content: Happy belated birthday to you Rague--Hope it was wonderful.
Posts.Title: Today is Rague's birthday!

Posts.Content: Welcome to these boards, its a great place to be when one has been thru what you and all of us have been thru to a greater or lesser degree. . I had 4 rounds of A/C, 1 1/2 rounds of Taxol, and 3 rounds of Taxotere. I couldnt take the taxol. My last chemo was march 30, 2010. I then had 33 radiation treatments. I was 66 when this all started and now I'm 68. We are all individual with different side effects, treatments and recovery. I just started beginning to feel like my old self again about 2 weeks ago. I'm sure age has something to do with it. I started juicing veggies and fruit in the fall of 2010 and just joined the gym 2 weeks ago. I still get fatigued but nothing like it was. I've noticed that I'm not as puffy as i was when i was going thru chemo. The numbness can last for a while, but you have been thru one of the more difficult forms of treatment and believe me IT DOES GET BETTER IN EACH INDIVIDUAL'S TIME. Hugs to you.
Posts.Title: Where do I go from here?

Posts.Content: Good News Lynn, I mean Great News! congrats
Posts.Title: Good to Go for Another Six Months

Posts.Content: I'm having a few lady friends over Monday morning for tea and coffee and we will discuss "Love" and what it really means to each of us. I've also printed some bible verses that speak of "Agape Love". I made some flourless chocolate individual heart shaped cakes, and will serve strawberries and cool whip to go along with the chocolate cakes and dark chocolate heart shaped candies. I made heart shaped pink iridescent earrings for each gal and we will celebrate and enjoy each other's company as we share friendship and love. So now I'm forced to get my butt in gear and do some dusting, straightening, and mopping. That is the downside, however an upside is that I have the energy to do it. Hubby and I havent discussed if we will do anything, but that's ok because we have shared love and the ups and downs of life for 38 years. Happy Early Valentines Day to all my Loving Pink Sisters.
Posts.Title: *~~~ Do You Have Any Special Plans For Valentine's Day? ~~~*

Posts.Content: I concur Al-Anon is extremely helpful not only dealing with someone's drinking, but teaching us how to take care of ourselves, and by golly girl you need to do that. Try Al-Anon before you decide to throw him to the wind. Life is tough, but cancer survivors are tougher and so are al-anon members. You will find a plethora of information at those al-anon meetings. It is so important that you take care of your emotional and physical health and Al-anon can certainly help. Wishing you peace and serenity.
Posts.Title: vent - husband being a jerk

Posts.Content: Thanks for sharing Bella. I'm always fascinated by different, but positive philosophies.
Posts.Title: Off the Topic... I saw the Dalai Lama speak yesterday at USC

Posts.Content: Cypress Cynthia you will be sharing your love and concern with all those special babies in your care. You are certainly a Special Valentine. Enjoy your time off with Danny when it arrrives. We can share love any day of the week any time of year.
Posts.Title: *~~~ Do You Have Any Special Plans For Valentine's Day? ~~~*

Posts.Content: Jean, I wish you lived closer too! Have a wonderful trip and enjoy and relax. You've had a couple of rough days. I think that all of us pink sisters would have an absolute fantastic time if we could all get together. It would be a blast with all the different personalities. Happy V Day. I dont know how to make those hearts you made so I'll just add some V's. VVVVVVVVV
Posts.Title: *~~~ Do You Have Any Special Plans For Valentine's Day? ~~~*

Posts.Content: Congratulations Remster!! Your words are an inspiration.
Posts.Title: Inflammatory Breast cancer

Posts.Content: Happy New Year to all the BC survivors on this website. May we all be blessed with health and happiness in the coming year. God bless us one and all. Cheers to a better year ahead. Happy 2010!!
Posts.Title: I Just Want To Wish All Of You A Very Healthy & Happy New Year!

Posts.Content: Sue you are one lucky gal. I love reading about you and your hubby's dates. sooo romantic--happy it was a wondrful Valentines Day for you.

Posts.Content: OMG Jo Jo you and your family have my prayers at this devastating time. Pink sisters never fail, we are kindred spirits. Please continue to come to us for comfort and support.

Posts.Content: OMG Jo Jo you and your family have my prayers at this devastating time. Pink sisters never fail, we are kindred spirits. Please continue to come to us for comfort and support.

Posts.Content: CC read the story and must tell you that you are the first Iguana pet owner I've heard from. High maintenance for sure, but obviously Fluffy brought you great joy. It's a good story, but must admit an Iguana would not be my choice. Bless you lady. I'll tell this one to Troy when he is older.
Posts.Title: OT Iguana Story

Posts.Content: Yes still tender, itchy nipple, onc said the itchy comes from nerve endings.Â  My port area is more sensitive than the breast and I'm always uncomfortable with the lymphedema.
Posts.Title: Breast still tender 1yr later after lumpectomy

Posts.Content: Laurissa I took the big step yesterday. Could no longer handle hair falling all over the place. I have some peach fuzz and am wearing a scarf. hate the thought of the wig, because its itchy and its hot in Florida. I also pulled out some ball caps that my hubby adjusted. I feel comfortable and FREE. When hubby and I figure out how to transfer photos to the website I'll try to add a current photo with scarf or wig. :)
Posts.Title: I'm BUZZED (clipper buzzed that is)
